column4: the guys having similar probs but nothing suggested there works for me
are you sure its the same chip?
because this is a windows machine all over...stickers and all lol
so why hasn't anybody told me about this in the days i have been asking people?
i assume recompiling a kernel is harder than my computer science algorithms assignment?
do i need to hack the C code?
and how can I recompile it when I am using the kernel to run my system lol
it just annoys me that Ubuntu works so well on all the other laptops i have installed it on but this
so what new stuff do i need to compile into the kernel?
did you see the link ubotu sent you?  it gives you all instructions on recompiling
yes...and it also tells me if i just need a new driver i shouldn't have to recompile
that's usually true, yeah.  You need to know what hardware you need the driver for, and then poke around on google/etc to get instructions on installing those drivers
feisty was released a few weeks ago, yes.
